StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: The Finland-United States Investigation of NIDDM Genetics (FUSION) study

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: We thank the FUSION investigators and study participants for making their data available. This manuscript was not prepared in collaboration with the FUSION investigators and does not necessarily reflect the opinions or views of the FUSION study or the NIDDK.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: The Finland-United States Investigation of NIDDM Genetics (FUSION) study
StudyInfo.Description: The Finland-United States Investigation of NIDDM Genetics (FUSION) study is a long-term effort to identify genetic variants that predispose to type 2 diabetes (T2D) or that impact the variability of T2D-related quantitative traits. The initial effort involved linkage analysis of affected-sibling-pair (ASP) families based on over 5,000 individuals living in Finland, and association fine mapping based on these family members and additional T2D cases and controls. Recently we completed a genome-wide association scan on 1161 T2D cases and 1174 normal glucose tolerant (NGT) controls. Individual-level data is available here for the 919 T2D cases and 787 NGT controls who reconsented to the use of their data or are deceased. Version 3 adds individual-level data for additional phenotypic variables.
StudyInfo.StudyHistory:
• Oct 1994 - Apr 1996: FUSION 1 ASP family primary data collection
  • Dec 1996 - Aug 1998: FUSION 2 ASP primary data collection and collection of additional FUSION 1 family members
  • 2000: FUSION 1 linkage genome scan papers published
  • 2004: FUSION 2 linkage genome scan paper published
  • 2004 - 2006: sampling of additional FUSION 1 and 2 family members and unrelated T2D cases and NGT controls from Finrisk 2002 and other studies
  • 2006: Genome-wide association scan genotyping completed
  • 2007: T2D genome-wide association scan paper published in Science

ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: These data may be used scientists to address medical research questions.
